meanings.definition: Deprives of the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: Not letting someone vote disenfranchises them.
meanings.sent2: Being unable to vote disenfranchises citizens.
meanings.sent3: When the robot refused to let the cat vote, it disenfranchised the feline community.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain disenfranchised the hikers from reaching the mountain peak.
meanings.sent5: The locked gate stood as a barrier that disenfranchised the eager voters.

meanings.definition: Excludes from a privilege or right.
meanings.sent1: The strict dress code disenfranchises students from wearing casual clothes.
meanings.sent2: His behavior disenfranchises him from attending the party.
meanings.sent3: The closed sign on the ice cream shop disenfranchised the kids from enjoying a sweet treat.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of flying disenfranchised her from experiencing the thrill of travel.
meanings.sent5: The exclusive club's high fees disenfranchised many potential members.
